translated: Abhidharma-jÃ±Äna-prasthÄna-Äá¹£á¹­agrantha-Å›Ästra, fascicle 18
Composed by KÄtyÄyanÄ«putra
Tripiá¹­aka master Saá¹ƒghadeva of KaÅ›mÄ«ra during the Fu Qin dynasty
The four great elements and the derived are called conditions. Those who have realized the truth
Create themselves later.

The chapter on pure faculties, the first chapter on the four great elements and the derived, how many are visible, how many are invisible, how many are resistant, how many are non-resistant, how many are contaminated, how many are uncontaminated, how many are conditioned, how many are unconditioned, how many are past, how many are future, how many are present, how many are wholesome, how many are unwholesome, how many are indeterminate, how many are bound to the desire realm, how many are bound to the form realm, how many are unbound, how many are learners, how many are post-learners, how many are neither learners nor post-learners, how many are eliminated by cultivation, and how many are not eliminated?
If one possesses the four great elements, does one also possess derived form?
If one possesses derived form, does one also possess the four great elements?
If one does not possess the four great elements, does one also not possess derived form?

If one does not accomplish derivative form, does one not accomplish the four great elements? [End of] derivative form.ğŸ”½If one accomplishes the four great elements, does one accomplish wholesome form?
If one accomplishes wholesome form, does one accomplish the four great elements?ğŸ”½If one accomplishes the four great elements, does one accomplish unwholesome form?
If one accomplishes unwholesome form, does one accomplish the four great elements?ğŸ”½If one accomplishes the four great elements, does one accomplish obscured-neutral form?
If one accomplishes obscured-neutral form, does one accomplish the four great elements?
If one accomplishes the four great elements, does one accomplish unobscured-neutral form?

If one accomplishes unobscured-neutral form, does one accomplish the four great elements? [End of] single-gate [conclusions].ğŸ”½If one accomplishes the four great elements, does one accomplish wholesome and unwholesome form?ğŸ”½If one accomplishes wholesome and unwholesome form, does one accomplish the four great elements?
If one accomplishes the four great elements, does one accomplish wholesome and obscured-neutral form?
If one possesses wholesome and obscured-neutral form, do they possess the four great elements?ğŸ”½If one possesses the four great elements, do they possess wholesome and unobscured-neutral form?
If one possesses wholesome and unobscured-neutral form, do they possess the four great elements?ğŸ”½If one possesses the four great elements, do they possess unwholesome and obscured-neutral form?
If one possesses unwholesome and obscured-neutral form, do they possess the four great elements?ğŸ”½If one possesses the four great elements, do they possess unwholesome and unobscured-neutral form?
If one possesses unwholesome and unobscured-neutral form, do they possess the four great elements?

If one possesses the four great elements, do they possess obscured-neutral and unobscured-neutral form?ğŸ”½If one possesses obscured-neutral and unobscured-neutral form, do they possess the four great elements?

If one possesses the four great elements, does one possess wholesome, unwholesome, and obscured-neutral form?ğŸ”½If one possesses wholesome, unwholesome, and obscured-neutral form, does one possess the four great elements?

If one possesses the four great elements, does one possess wholesome, unwholesome, and unobscured-neutral form?ğŸ”½If one possesses wholesome, unwholesome, and unobscured-neutral form, does one possess the four great elements?ğŸ”½If one possesses the four great elements, does one possess wholesome, obscured-neutral, and unobscured-neutral form?
If one possesses wholesome, obscured-neutral, and unobscured-neutral form, does one possess the four great elements?

If one possesses the four great elements, does one possess unwholesome, obscured-neutral, and unobscured-neutral form?ğŸ”½If one possesses unwholesome, obscured-neutral, and unobscured-neutral form, does one possess the four great elements? (Chapter 3, Part 3)
If one possesses the four great elements, does one possess wholesome, unwholesome, obscured-neutral, and unobscured-neutral form?
If one possesses wholesome, unwholesome, obscured-neutral, and unobscured-neutral form, does one possess the four great elements? (End of Chapter on the Four Great Elements)
If one possesses wholesome form, does one possess unwholesome form?
If one possesses unwholesome form, does one possess wholesome form?ğŸ”½If one possesses wholesome form, does one possess obscured-neutral form?
If one possesses obscured-neutral form, does one possess wholesome form?

If one possesses wholesome form, does one possess unobscured-neutral form?ğŸ”½If one possesses unobscured-neutral form, does one possess wholesome form? (End of Chapter on Wholesome Form)ğŸ”½If one possesses wholesome form, does one possess unwholesome and obscured-neutral form?
If one possesses unwholesome and obscured-neutral form, does one possess wholesome form?
If one possesses wholesome form, does one possess unwholesome and non-obscured-neutral form?
If one possesses unwholesome and non-obscured-neutral form, does one possess wholesome form?

If one possesses wholesome form, does one possess obscured-neutral and non-obscured-neutral form?ğŸ”½If one possesses obscured-neutral and non-obscured-neutral form, does one possess wholesome form?ğŸ”½If one possesses wholesome form, does one possess unwholesome, obscured-neutral, and non-obscured-neutral form?
If one possesses unwholesome, obscured-neutral, and non-obscured-neutral form, does one possess wholesome form?
If one possesses unwholesome form, does one possess obscured-neutral form?ğŸ”½If one possesses obscured-neutral form, does one possess unwholesome form?
If one possesses unwholesome form, does one possess non-obscured-neutral form?
If one possesses non-obscured-neutral form, does one possess unwholesome form?ğŸ”½If one possesses unwholesome form, does one possess obscured-neutral and non-obscured-neutral form?

If one possesses obscured-neutral and non-obscured-neutral form, does one possess unwholesome form? (Unwholesome is finished.)ğŸ”½If one possesses obscured-neutral form, does one possess non-obscured-neutral form?
If one possesses non-obscured-neutral form, does one possess obscured-neutral form?
By which samÄdhi are the four great elements extinguished?

translated: By which samÄdhi are form, anger, tangible objects, initial thought, sustained thought, the faculty of pleasure, the faculty of pain, the faculty of joy, the faculty of depression, the faculty of equanimity, the food of solid nutriment, the food of contact, the food of mental intention, and the food of consciousness extinguished?
When the four great elements are completely extinguished without remainder, what fruits are said to be produced?

translated: Form, anger, resistance, pleasure, pain, joy, sorrow, equanimity, food by mouthfuls, pleasure, intention, and consciousness - by which samÄdhi are they extinguished?
When the four great elements are completely exhausted, what fruit is said to be produced?
Please explain the meaning of this chapter in full.
How many of the four great elements and the derived elements are visible?
Answer:
One.
How many are invisible?
Answer:
Eight, two with a small part.
How many are resistant?
Answer:
Nine, one with a small part.
How many are non-resistant?
Answer:
One with a small part.
How many are contaminated?
Answer:
Nine, two with a small part.
How many are uncontaminated?
Answer:
One with a small part.
How many are conditioned?
Answer:
Nine, two with a small part.
How many are past?
Answer:
Eleven with a small part.
How many are future?
Answer:
Eleven are partially homogeneous.
How many are present?
Answer:
Eleven are partially homogeneous.
How many are wholesome?
Answer:
Three are partially homogeneous.
How many are unwholesome?
Answer:
Three are partially homogeneous.
How many are indeterminate?
Answer:
Seven, three are partially homogeneous.
How many are bound to the desire realm?
Answer:
Two, nine are partially homogeneous.
How many are bound to the form realm?
Answer:
Nine are partially homogeneous.
How many are unbound?
Answer:
One is partially homogeneous.
How many are learners?
Answer:
One is partially homogeneous.
How many are adepts?
Answer:
One is partially homogeneous.
How many are neither learners nor adepts?
Answer:
Nine, two are partially homogeneous.
How many are eliminated by cultivation?
Answer:
Nine, two are partially homogeneous.
How many are not eliminated?
Answer:
One is partially homogeneous. The section on entering is completed.
If one possesses the four great elements, does one possess derivative form?
Answer:
It is so. If one possesses the four great elements, one possesses derivative form.
Can one possess derivative form but not the four great elements?
Answer:
There is. A pure person born in the formless realm.
If one does not possess the four great elements, does one not possess derivative form?
Answer:
It is so. If one does not possess derivative form, one does not possess the four great elements.
Can one not possess the four great elements but not not possess derivative form?
Answer:
There is. A pure person born in the formless realm.
If one possesses the four great elements, does one possess wholesome form?
Answer:
One may possess the four great elements but not wholesome form.
What is meant by possessing the four great elements but not wholesome form?
Answer:

Ordinary people in the mother's womb or egg membrane gradually thicken, if born in the desire realm in a place without precepts, good bodily and verbal actions without teaching, previously had teaching but then lost it;

in a place without precepts or without not keeping precepts, good bodily and verbal actions without teaching, previously had teaching but then lost it, this is called possessing the four great elements but not good form.
What is meant by possessing good form but not the four great elements?
The answer is:
The undefiled person born in the formless realm, this is called possessing good form but not the four great elements.
What is meant by possessing the four great elements and good form?
The answer is:

The undefiled person in the mother's womb or egg membrane gradually thickening, if born in the desire realm in a place with precepts, without precepts, or neither with nor without precepts, with good bodily and verbal actions with teaching, previously had teaching and did not lose it, if born in the form realm, this is called possessing the four great elements and good form.
What is meant by not possessing the four great elements and not good form?
The answer is:
Ordinary people born in the formless realm are said to neither possess the four great elements nor possess wholesome form.
If one possesses the four great elements, do they possess unwholesome form?
Answer:
It is like this. If one possesses unwholesome form, do they possess the four great elements?
Can one possess the four great elements but not unwholesome form?
Answer:

There are those in the mother's womb, in the egg, whose membranes gradually thicken. If born in the desire realm, in a place with precepts, with no teaching of unwholesome body and speech, or having had the teaching but then lost it, also in a place without precepts or without not-precepts, with no teaching of unwholesome body and speech, or having had the teaching but then lost it, or if born in the form realm.
If one possesses the four great elements, do they possess obscured and indeterminate form?
Answer:
It is like this. If one possesses obscured and indeterminate form, they possess the four great elements.
Can one possess the four great elements but not obscured and indeterminate form?
Answer:
Yes, if born in the desire realm, or if born in the form realm and possessing the non-obscured-neutral bodily and verbal non-manifestations.
If one possesses the four great elements, does one possess non-obscured-neutral form?
Answer:
So it is.
If one possesses non-obscured-neutral form, does one possess the four great elements?
Answer:
The single case is finished.
If one possesses the four great elements, does one possess wholesome and unwholesome form?
Answer:
One may possess the four great elements but not wholesome or unwholesome form, wholesome form but not unwholesome form, unwholesome form but not wholesome form, or wholesome and unwholesome form.
What is meant by possessing the four great elements but not wholesome or unwholesome form?
Answer:

Ordinary people in the mother's womb or egg, with the membranes gradually thickening, or if born in the desire realm, not abiding in precepts or not abiding in non-precepts, with wholesome or unwholesome bodily and verbal non-manifestations, or having previously had manifestations that have been lost - this is called possessing the four great elements but not wholesome or unwholesome form.
How does one possess the four great elements and wholesome form but not unwholesome form?
The answer is:

A person without defilements in the mother's womb, the membranes gradually thickening, if born in the desire realm, in a place with precepts, with no expression of unwholesome body and speech, having had expression it is immediately lost;

also in a place with neither precepts nor non-precepts, with the expression of wholesome body and speech, having had expression it is not lost, with no expression of unwholesome body and speech, having had expression it is immediately lost;
if born in the form realm, this is called possessing the four great elements and wholesome form but not unwholesome form.
How does one possess the four great elements and wholesome form but not wholesome form?
The answer is:

Born in the desire realm, in a place with non-precepts, with no expression of wholesome body and speech, having had expression it is immediately lost, also in a place with neither precepts nor non-precepts, with the expression of unwholesome body and speech, having had expression it is not lost, with no expression of wholesome body and speech, having had expression it is immediately lost, this is called possessing the four great elements and wholesome form but not wholesome form.
How does one possess the four great elements and both wholesome and unwholesome form?
The answer is:
If one is born in the desire realm, in a place with precepts, with unwholesome bodily and verbal expression, and previously had such expression that was not lost;
in a place without precepts, with wholesome bodily and verbal expression, and previously had such expression that was not lost;

also in a place that is neither with precepts nor without precepts, with wholesome and unwholesome bodily and verbal expression, and previously had such expression that was not lost - this is called possessing the four great elements and both wholesome and unwholesome form.
If one possesses wholesome and unwholesome form, does one possess the four great elements?
The answer is:
So it is.
If one possesses the four great elements, does one possess wholesome and obscured-neutral form?
The answer is:
One may possess the four great elements but not wholesome or obscured-neutral form, or wholesome form but not obscured-neutral form, or wholesome and obscured-neutral form.
How does one possess the four great elements but not wholesome or obscured-neutral form?
The answer is:

Ordinary people in the mother's womb or egg membrane gradually thicken, if born in the desire realm in a place of non-precepts, with good body and speech without teaching, the original teaching is lost;

Also in a place of neither precepts nor non-precepts, with good body and speech without teaching, the original teaching is lost, this is called possessing the four great elements but not good or obscured neutral form.
What is meant by possessing the four great elements and good form but not obscured neutral form?
Answer:

The untainted person in the mother's womb or egg membrane gradually thickens, if born in the desire realm in a place of precepts, non-precepts, or neither precepts nor non-precepts, with good body and speech with teaching, the original teaching is not lost;
If born in the form realm with obscured neutral body and speech without teaching, this is called possessing the four great elements and good form but not obscured neutral form.
What is meant by possessing the four great elements and good obscured neutral form?
Answer:
If one is born in the form realm and has concealed and indeterminate bodily and verbal informative form, this is called possessing the four great elements and good concealed and indeterminate form.
If one possesses good concealed and indeterminate form, do they possess the four great elements?
Answer:
It is like this.
If one possesses the four great elements, do they possess good and unobscured indeterminate form?
Answer:
There are those who possess the four great elements and unobscured indeterminate form but not good form, and those who possess good and unobscured indeterminate form.
How does one possess the four great elements and unobscured indeterminate form but not good form?
Answer:

Ordinary people in the mother's womb or egg, with the membranes gradually thickening, if born in the desire realm in a place without precepts, with no bodily and verbal unwholesome informative form, or having had such form it is lost;

also in a place without precepts or without not-not precepts, with no bodily and verbal unwholesome informative form, or having had such form it is lost, this is called possessing the four great elements and unobscured indeterminate form but not good form.
How does one possess the four great elements and wholesome and non-obscured-indeterminate form?
The answer is:

A person without defilements in the mother's womb, the membranes gradually thickening, if born in the desire realm, in a place with precepts, in a place without precepts, and also in a place neither with nor without precepts, with wholesome bodily and verbal actions, with previous teachings not lost;
if born in the form realm, this is called possessing the four great elements and wholesome and non-obscured-indeterminate form.
If one possesses wholesome and non-obscured-indeterminate form, do they possess the four great elements?
The answer is:
It is like this.
If one possesses the four great elements, do they possess unwholesome and obscured-indeterminate form?
The answer is:
No.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½
If one possesses the four great elements, do they possess unwholesome and non-obscured-indeterminate form?
The answer is:
One may possess the four great elements and non-obscured-indeterminate form but not unwholesome form, and unwholesome and non-obscured-indeterminate form.
How does one possess the four great elements and non-obscuring indeterminate form, but not unwholesome form?
The answer is:

If one is in the mother's womb or egg membrane, or if one is born in the desire realm in a place with precepts, and there is no expression of unwholesome bodily and verbal actions, or if one had expression but has lost it, and also in a place that is neither with precepts nor without precepts, there is no expression of unwholesome bodily and verbal actions, or if one had expression but has lost it;
or if one is born in the form realm, one possesses the four great elements and non-obscuring indeterminate form, but not unwholesome form.
How does one possess the four great elements, unwholesome form, and non-obscuring indeterminate form?
The answer is:
If one is born in the desire realm in a place with precepts, and there is expression of unwholesome bodily and verbal actions, or if one had expression and has not lost it;

or in a place without precepts or in a place that is neither with precepts nor without precepts, there is expression of unwholesome bodily and verbal actions, or if one had expression and has not lost it, one possesses the four great elements, unwholesome form, and non-obscuring indeterminate form.
If one possesses unwholesome and non-obscured-neutral form, does one possess the four great elements?
Answer:
It is so.
If one possesses the four great elements, does one possess obscured-neutral and non-obscured-neutral form?
Answer:

One may possess the four great elements and non-obscured-neutral form but not obscured-neutral form, and one may possess the four great elements and both obscured-neutral and non-obscured-neutral form.
How does one possess the four great elements and non-obscured-neutral form but not obscured-neutral form?
Answer:

Those born in the desire realm or those born in the form realm who do not have obscured-neutral bodily and verbal non-manifest karma - this is called possessing the four great elements and non-obscured-neutral form but not obscured-neutral form.
How does one possess the four great elements and both obscured-neutral and non-obscured-neutral form?
Answer:

If one is born in the form realm and has concealed and indeterminate bodily and verbal informative form, one is said to possess the four great elements and concealed and indeterminate form, but not unconcealed indeterminate form.
If one possesses concealed and indeterminate form and unconcealed indeterminate form, do they possess the four great elements?
Answer:
Thus ends the double [questions].
If one possesses the four great elements, do they possess wholesome, unwholesome, and concealed indeterminate form?ğŸ”½Answer:
No.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½
If one possesses the four great elements, do they possess wholesome, unwholesome, and unconcealed indeterminate form?
Answer:

There are four possibilities: One may possess the four great elements and unconcealed indeterminate form, but not wholesome or unwholesome form; one may possess wholesome and unconcealed indeterminate form, but not unwholesome form; one may possess unwholesome and unconcealed indeterminate form, but not wholesome form; one may possess wholesome, unwholesome, and unconcealed indeterminate form.
What is meant by possessing the four great elements and unconcealed indeterminate form, but not wholesome or unwholesome form?
Answer:

Ordinary people in the mother's womb or egg membrane gradually thicken, or if born in the desire realm, in a place of neither precepts nor non-precepts, with neither good nor evil bodily or verbal actions, or with previous actions lost, this is called possessing the four great elements and hidden and neutral form, but not good or evil form.
What is meant by possessing the four great elements and good and hidden and neutral form, but not evil form?
The answer is:

Immaculate people in the mother's womb or egg membrane gradually thicken, or if born in the desire realm in a place of precepts, with neither good nor evil bodily or verbal actions, or with previous actions lost;

Or in a place of neither precepts nor non-precepts, with good bodily and verbal actions, or with previous actions not lost, and with neither good nor evil bodily or verbal actions, or with previous actions lost;
Or if born in the form realm, this is called possessing the four great elements and good and hidden and neutral form, but not evil form.
What is meant by possessing the four great elements and evil and hidden and neutral form, but not good form?
Answer:
If born in the desire realm in a place without precepts, there is no teaching of good body and speech, and previously existing teachings are lost;

Also in a place without precepts or without not-precepts, there is teaching of unwholesome body and speech, and previously existing teachings are not lost, but there is no teaching of good body and speech, and previously existing teachings are lost. This is called possessing the four great elements and unwholesome and non-obscured-neutral form, but not good form.
What is meant by possessing the four great elements and good, unwholesome, and non-obscured-neutral form?
Answer:
If born in the desire realm in a place with precepts, there is teaching of unwholesome body and speech, and previously existing teachings are not lost;
In a place without precepts, there is teaching of good body and speech, and previously existing teachings are not lost;

Also in a place without precepts or without not-precepts, there is teaching of good and unwholesome body and speech, and previously existing teachings are not lost. This is called possessing the four great elements and good, unwholesome, and non-obscured-neutral form.
If one possesses wholesome, unwholesome, and non-obscured-indeterminate form, do they possess the four great elements?
Answer:
It is so.
If one possesses the four great elements, do they possess wholesome, obscured-indeterminate, and unobscured-indeterminate form?
Answer:

There are those who possess the four great elements and unobscured-indeterminate form but not wholesome or obscured-indeterminate form, those who possess wholesome and unobscured-indeterminate form but not obscured-indeterminate form, and those who possess wholesome, obscured-indeterminate, and unobscured-indeterminate form.
What is meant by possessing the four great elements and unobscured-indeterminate form but not wholesome or obscured-indeterminate form?
Answer:

Ordinary people in the mother's womb or egg, where the membranes gradually thicken, or those born in the desire realm who are not in a state of moral discipline, with no teaching of wholesome bodily and verbal actions, or who have previously had the teaching but have lost it;

Neither observing precepts nor not observing precepts, with good bodily and verbal actions without teaching, or originally having teaching but losing it, this is called possessing the four great elements and non-obscuring indeterminate form, but not possessing obscured indeterminate form.
What about possessing the four great elements and good non-obscuring indeterminate form, but not obscured indeterminate form?
Answer:

A person without defilements in the mother's womb, with the egg membrane gradually thickening, if born in the desire realm, in a place observing precepts, not observing precepts, or neither observing precepts nor not observing precepts, with good bodily and verbal actions with teaching, or originally having teaching without losing it;

if born in the form realm, with obscured indeterminate bodily and verbal actions without teaching, this is called possessing the four great elements and good non-obscuring indeterminate form, but not obscured indeterminate form.
What about possessing the four great elements and good obscured indeterminate form and non-obscuring indeterminate form?
Answer:

If one is born in the form realm and has concealed and indeterminate bodily and verbal actions, this is called possessing the four great elements, wholesome, concealed and indeterminate, and non-concealed indeterminate form.
If one possesses wholesome, concealed and indeterminate, and non-concealed indeterminate form, do they possess the four great elements?
Answer:
It is like this.
If one possesses the four great elements, do they possess unwholesome, concealed and indeterminate, and non-concealed indeterminate form?
Answer:
There are no three.
If one possesses the four great elements, do they possess wholesome, unwholesome, concealed and indeterminate, and non-concealed indeterminate form?
Answer:
This is also not the case. (End of section on the four great elements)
If one possesses wholesome form, do they possess unwholesome form?
Answer:
Either one possesses wholesome form but not unwholesome form,
How does one possess wholesome form but not unwholesome form?
Answer:

If a person without defilements is in the mother's womb or egg membrane, if born in the desire realm in a place with precepts, with neither good nor evil bodily and verbal actions, having had precepts, they are lost; also in a place with neither precepts nor non-precepts, with good bodily and verbal actions, having had precepts, they are not lost; with neither good nor evil bodily and verbal actions, having had precepts, they are lost;
if born in the form realm;
if a person without defilements is born in the formless realm, this is called attaining good form but not evil form.
How does one attain evil form but not good form?
The answer is:
if born in the desire realm in a place with non-precepts, with neither good nor evil bodily and verbal actions, having had precepts, they are lost;

also in a place with neither precepts nor non-precepts, with evil bodily and verbal actions, having had precepts, they are not lost; with neither good nor evil bodily and verbal actions, having had precepts, they are lost; this is called attaining evil form but not good form.
How does one attain good form and evil form?
The answer is:
In the desire realm, in a place with precepts, there is good bodily and verbal expression, and previously obtained expression is not lost;
In a place without precepts, there is good bodily and verbal expression, and previously obtained expression is not lost;

Also, in a place that is neither with precepts nor without precepts, there is good and bad bodily and verbal expression, and previously obtained expression is not lost. This is called possessing good and bad form.
How does one not possess good and bad form?
The answer is:

Ordinary people in the mother's womb or egg, with the membranes gradually thickening, or born in the desire realm in a place that is neither with precepts nor without precepts, with no good or bad bodily and verbal expression, and previously obtained expression lost, or ordinary people born in the formless realm. This is called not possessing good form and bad form.
If one possesses good form, does one possess concealed indeterminate form?
The answer is:
So it is.
If one possesses concealed indeterminate form, one possesses good form.
Can one possess good form but not obscured-neutral form?
The answer is:

There are cases where one possesses good form but not obscured-neutral form. A person without defilements in the mother's womb, the membranes gradually thickening, born in the desire realm, in a place with precepts, in a place without precepts, and also in a place that is neither with nor without precepts, with good bodily and verbal expression, having had expression before without losing it;
if born in the form realm, with obscured-neutral bodily and verbal non-expression;
if a person without defilements is born in the formless realm.
If one possesses good form, do they possess unobscured-neutral form?
The answer is:
There are cases where one possesses good form but not unobscured-neutral form.
How does one possess good form but not unobscured-neutral form?
The answer is:
A person without defilements born in the formless realm - this is called possessing good form but not unobscured-neutral form.
How does one possess unobscured-neutral form but not good form?
The answer is:

Ordinary people in the mother's womb, the egg membrane gradually thickens, if born in the desire realm, not in a place of precepts, good bodily and verbal actions without teaching, the original teaching is lost;

Also not in a place of precepts or not precepts, good bodily and verbal actions without teaching, the original teaching is lost, this is called accomplishing non-obscured indeterminate form but not good form.
What is meant by accomplishing good form and non-obscured indeterminate form?
Answer:

The defiled person in the mother's womb, the egg membrane gradually thickens, if born in the desire realm, in a place of precepts, not in a place of precepts, also not in a place of precepts or not precepts, good bodily and verbal actions with teaching, the original teaching is not lost;
If born in the form realm, this is called accomplishing good form and non-obscured indeterminate form.
What is meant by not accomplishing good form and non-obscured indeterminate form?
Answer:
Ordinary people born in the formless realm, this is called not accomplishing good form and non-obscured indeterminate form. The single case is finished.
If one possesses wholesome form, does one possess unwholesome and obscured-neutral form?
Answer:
This is also not the case.
If one possesses wholesome form, does one possess unwholesome and unobscured-neutral form?
Answer:
One may possess wholesome form but not unwholesome or unobscured-neutral form, or unobscured-neutral form but not unwholesome form, or unwholesome and unobscured-neutral form.
How does one possess wholesome form but not unwholesome or unobscured-neutral form?
Answer:
Those with outflows who are born in the formless realm possess wholesome form but not unwholesome or unobscured-neutral form.
How does one possess wholesome form and unobscured-neutral form but not unwholesome form?
Answer:

If a person without defilements is in the mother's womb or egg membrane, if born in the desire realm in a place with precepts, there is no teaching of unwholesome body and speech, and previous teaching is lost. Also in a place with neither precepts nor non-precepts, there is teaching of wholesome body and speech, and previous teaching is not lost. Unwholesome body and speech have no teaching, and previous teaching is lost.
If born in the form realm, this is called attaining wholesome form and obscured neutral form, but not unwholesome form.
What is meant by attaining wholesome form and unwholesome obscured neutral form?
The answer is:
If born in the desire realm in a place with precepts, there is teaching of unwholesome body and speech, and previous teaching is not lost.
In a place with non-precepts, there is teaching of wholesome body and speech, and previous teaching is not lost.

Also in a place with neither precepts nor non-precepts, there is teaching of wholesome and unwholesome body and speech, and previous teaching is not lost. This is called attaining wholesome form and unwholesome obscured neutral form.
If one possesses unwholesome and non-obscured-neutral form, does one possess wholesome form?
Answer:
Either one possesses or does not possess.
How does one possess?
Answer:
As explained above, this is called possessing.
How does one not possess?
Answer:
Being born in the desire realm, in a place without precepts, with no expression of wholesome body and speech, having previously had expression that has been lost;

Also in a place without precepts or without not-precepts, with the expression of unwholesome body and speech, having previously had expression that has not been lost, with no expression of wholesome body and speech, having previously had expression that has been lost - this is called not possessing.
If one possesses wholesome form, does one possess obscured-neutral and unobscured-neutral form?
Answer:

Either one possesses wholesome form but not obscured-neutral and unobscured-neutral form, or one possesses unobscured-neutral form but not obscured-neutral form, or one possesses obscured-neutral and unobscured-neutral form.
How does one possess good form but not obscured-neutral or unobscured-neutral form?
The answer is:
A stainless person born in the formless realm possesses good form but not obscured-neutral or unobscured-neutral form.
How does one possess good form and unobscured-neutral form but not obscured-neutral form?
The answer is:

A stainless person in the mother's womb, gradually thickening the membranes, if born in the desire realm, in a place of precepts, in a place of non-precepts, or in a place of neither precepts nor non-precepts, with good bodily and verbal expression, having had expression before without losing it;
If born in the form realm, with obscured bodily and verbal non-expression, this is called possessing good form and unobscured-neutral form but not obscured-neutral form.
How does one possess good form and obscured-neutral form and unobscured-neutral form?
The answer is:

If one is born in the form realm and has concealed and indeterminate bodily and verbal actions, this is called possessing wholesome form and concealed and indeterminate form, but not unobscured indeterminate form.
If one possesses concealed and indeterminate form and unobscured indeterminate form, do they possess wholesome form?
Answer:
Thus ends the double [question].
If one possesses wholesome form, do they possess unwholesome form, concealed indeterminate form, and unobscured indeterminate form?
Answer:
This is also not the case. (End of wholesome form.)
If one possesses unwholesome form, do they possess concealed indeterminate form?
Answer:
This is not the case.
If one possesses unwholesome form, do they possess unobscured indeterminate form?
Answer:
Thus, if one possesses unwholesome form, they possess unobscured indeterminate form.
Can one possess unobscured indeterminate form but not unwholesome form?
Answer:

Yes, when in the mother's womb or egg, the membranes gradually thicken, or if born in the desire realm, in a place with precepts, with unwholesome bodily and verbal actions without teaching, or having previously had teaching but then lost it, or in a place with neither precepts nor non-precepts, with unwholesome bodily and verbal actions without teaching, or having previously had teaching but then lost it,
or if born in the form realm.
If one possesses unwholesome form, does one also possess obscured-neutral and unobscured-neutral form?
Answer:
This is the end of the discussion on unwholesome [form].
If one possesses obscured-neutral form, does one also possess unobscured-neutral form?
Answer:
It is like this, if one possesses obscured-neutral form, one also possesses unobscured-neutral form.
Is it possible to possess unobscured-neutral form but not obscured-neutral form?
Answer:
Yes, when born in the desire realm or form realm, with obscured-neutral bodily and verbal actions without teaching.
By which samÄdhi are the four great elements extinguished?
Answer:
Either based on four or based on the future.
Derived form, either based on four or based on the future.
Tangible objects, pleasant feeling, with perception and thought, either based on the first or based on the future.
The faculty of pleasure, either based on three or based on the future.
The faculty of joy, either based on two or based on the future.
The faculty of pain, the faculty of sorrow, and physical food, based on the future.
The faculty of equanimity, the food of contact, the food of mental volition, and the food of consciousness, either based on seven or based on the future.
When the four great elements are completely exhausted without remainder, what fruit should they be said to produce?
Answer:

translated: The fruit of arhatship, or there is no such case. Derived form, tangible objects, pleasant feeling, with perception and thought, the faculty of pleasure, the faculty of joy, the fruit of arhatship, or there is no such case. The faculty of pain, the faculty of sorrow, physical food, the fruit of non-returner and arhatship, or there is no such case. The faculty of equanimity, the food of contact, the food of mental volition, and the food of consciousness, the fruit of arhatship.
